text: Another of the many platforming mascots back then that bit the dust. Interestingly for those who didn't know, Croc was created by Argonaut Games who were responsible for the Super FX hardware on the SNES and Star Fox. They pitched the first game to Nintendo with Yoshi as the controllable character, but Nintendo rejected it which ended the relationship between both companies. Argonaut Games later shut down.
author: SupraDarky

text: SupraDarky well Nintendo sounds like a jerk letting them die
author: Lucio Fernandes

text:
Argounaut ever was an indipendent developer. It partnered with Nintendo in the 16-bit but never been bought by Nintendo.
The partneship ended in mid '90 (not a happy ending: Nintendo didn't published Star Fox 2 and rejected their 3D Yoshi's platform game) but Argonaut closed in the mid '00, well after that period, so is not Nintendo fault at all
